TopicTitle: American Rockets (Red Stone, Atlas, Titan II, Saturn IB and Saturn V) (updated Saturn V)

Articles.Content:
![Mercury%20Redstone.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/9346020/150526%20American%20Rocket%20Builders/Mercury%20Redstone.png)

[**DOWNLOAD**](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/9346020/150526%20American%20Rocket%20Builders/1_0_Mercury%20Atlas.craft)

*Don't go above an apoapsis of 80, or you will burn up, since no heat shield and form over function!*

![Mercury%20Atlas.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/9346020/150526%20American%20Rocket%20Builders/Mercury%20Atlas.png)

[**DOWNLOAD**](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/9346020/150526%20American%20Rocket%20Builders/1_0_Mercury%20Redstone.craft)

*The Atlas is automatically tilting into the right direction. Just make sure it doesn't get too silly. Oh and drop the extra engines around 25.000 - 30.000 or things will explode*

![Project%20Gemini.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/9346020/150526%20American%20Rocket%20Builders/Project%20Gemini.png)

[**DOWNLOAD**](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/9346020/150526%20American%20Rocket%20Builders/1_0_Titan%20II%20Gemini.craft)

*A dream to fly and very easy to get into a 90x90 orbit*

![Apollo%207.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/9346020/150526%20American%20Rocket%20Builders/Apollo%207.png)

[**DOWNLOAD**](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/9346020/150526%20American%20Rocket%20Builders/1_0_Saturn%20IB.craft)

*I might update the second stage this weekend so it has the same 3rd stage as the Saturn V*

![Apollo%2011.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/9346020/150526%20American%20Rocket%20Builders/Apollo%2011.png)

[**DOWNLOAD**](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/9346020/150526%20American%20Rocket%20Builders/1_0_Saturn%20V%20%26%20Apollo%2011b.craft)

*Unfortunately no Alsep yet, since the LM needs a bit more dV*

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-26T21:22:23Z" title="05/26/2015 09:22  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 26, 2015</time> by WooDzor**

HA! Fixed the Titan II, i knew I was supposed to have enough fuel, turns out a couple of fuel lines went wrong :-)

I'll upload it tomorrow, that thing is a dream to fly :-o

Wow.. this is just.. mind-blowing! Astounding work!

Repped!

EDIT: I'll have to spread it around first..

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-10T21:34:14Z" title="05/10/2015 09:34  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 10, 2015</time> by Columbia**

Really lovely craft there mate. It does, however, remind me of how badly the stock fairings sit with the other stock parts.. ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)

 Why are they so shiny Squad!? Why?

Downloadlink for the gemini updated :-) perfect is a big word, but this rocket gets pretty close..

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-16T05:24:24Z" title="05/16/2015 05:24  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 16, 2015</time> by WooDzor**
So, do you know that the Saturn V link leads to the Saturn IB page? Just wanted to point that out. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> So, do you know that the Saturn V link leads to the Saturn IB page? Just wanted to point that out. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Should be fixed now :-) Try again

![1.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/9346020/150509%20First%20Few%20Launches/1.png)

Launch! *Press space to start the engines, and when the rocket starts bounching up again press space again to release the launch clamps*

![2.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/9346020/150509%20First%20Few%20Launches/2.png)

Gravity turn *7500m - 70 degrees, 15000 - 45 degrees. First stage should be enough to get into space*

![3.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/9346020/150509%20First%20Few%20Launches/3.png)

Release of Stage I

![4.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/9346020/150509%20First%20Few%20Launches/4.png)

Release of the interstage fairing and the start of the 2 minute burn into orbit with Stage II

![5.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/9346020/150509%20First%20Few%20Launches/5.png)

Stage III is used to fly to the Mun. *Make sure Stage III aims below the surface of the Mun, the command module will get that everything back into a 20x20 orbit around the Mun later*

![6.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/9346020/150509%20First%20Few%20Launches/6.png)

Getting the MEM out

![7.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/9346020/150509%20First%20Few%20Launches/7.png)

To the Mun!

![8.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/9346020/150509%20First%20Few%20Launches/8.png)

And on our way down.. *be careful unlike the rest of the rocket the MEM is extremely tight on fuel.*

[**DOWNLOAD**](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/9346020/150509%20First%20Few%20Launches/1_0_Saturn%20V%20%26%20Apollo%2011b.craft) (rmb save as)
I downloaded it and can't work out how to separate the first interstage fairing separate to the first stage.

Just click space? It's all pretty well set up except for the engine and the sepatron on the LEM. I'll check it later today when I have half an hour or so ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) work work work ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

**Gemini + Titan II rocket for 1.05**  

Very easy to fly (works very well with the [gravity turn](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/129607-105-gravityturn-version-122-automated-efficient-launches/) mod)  and you should be able to get it up to a 120x120 orbit without using the retro engines. The Agena Target vehicle is still WIP, since I have to build an Atlas rocket first. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

![screenshot72.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/9346020/160121%20-%20Gemini%20Agena%20mission/screenshot72.png)
